author: PaulHigin
body: I added a new docs/new-features directory for new feature documentation, and also a remoting-over-ssh sub directory for the SSH remoting README.md document file.

comments.author: joeyaiello
comments.body:
Thanks for doing this Paul. We're trying not to start housing "user docs" in the GitHub repo with the exception of the demos we're associating with launch on 8/18. For that reason, can you move all this content into /demos/remoting instead of the docs here? 

Also, did you actually merge these changes up to `master`? I.e. do this actually work the alpha.9 bits?

comments.author: bgelens
comments.body:
I can confirm it works with alpha 9 :-) Linux -> Win10 and Win10 -> Linux verified.
Only thing missing is to include C:\Program Files\OpenSSH in System Path

comments.author: PaulHigin
comments.body: Ok, I have re-written most of the document and pushed the changes.  Please take another look.  Also different people tell me to put this readme in different locations.  Jason feels we need a new-features document location which is why I added it there.  Please decide where this should go.

comments.author: PaulHigin
comments.body: This looks to be a wrong document in a wrong place.  Will try again later.

title: Added Readme document for SSH remoting feature
